title: Strictly fans blast 'dreadful' camera work as week three takes to screens
text:

Strictly Come Dancing fans have been left upset by the camera work on tonight's live show as contestants went into their third week.

It caused an outrage on Twitter as fans were furious over the angles that captured the contestants' dance routines, and some claimed they couldn't see the footwork properly.

One fan blasted: "Why are the cameramen so rubbish?! They zoom in and zoom out at the wrong time. I’d actually like to see the footwork thanks"

"Is it just me or was the camera work a bit off on Strictly tonight? Feel like we didn’t get the full impact of Oti and Kelvin at all," another tweeted.

(Image: PA)

A third piped in: "Mind you, there was some dreadful camera work that missed key parts of the dance #Strictly "

Viewers mostly hated the fact that they couldn't see their favourite couples feet during their dance routines, and have pleaded with the cameramen to sort it out.

"I’ve said it before, I’ll say it again. @bbcstrictly For the love of cake, please sort the camera work!

(Image: BBC)

"I can’t be the only one that hates the spinning shots but the thing that grinds me most is that you don’t always show the feet! It’s a bloody dancing show! #Strictly"

It seems others thought the "dodgy" shots were missing "key moves" throughout the show.

(Image: PA)

It comes after Tess Daly burst into a fit of laughter after judge Craig Revel Horwood mocked Anton's "fake teeth".

The presenter couldn't hold back her giggling after the ordeal, and continued to do so as Craig was giving feedback to Anton.

Tess then admitted it was "slightly embarrassing" as Craig apologised for mocking Anton.

(Image: BBC)

But the professional dancer seemed to laugh it off as he turned to face the audience and mouthed something about Craig.

Judge Motsi added: "Now we know - the teeth are real guys, that has been cleared!" and she turned to speak to Emma about their routine, with Tess still in heaps of laughter.

It seems it will be a moment that will go down in the show's history.
description: Fans of the hit show have hit out at cameramen for the "dodgy" angles
